column4: -- You know about img2txt.  Is there a pastebinit for photos?
The ubuntu-restricted-extras package should grab everything you need.
I broke my arm, only typing wirh one hand at the moment, sorry :)
I read somewhere that I should be avoiding ubuntu-restricted-extras.
Full of dirty hacks, workarounds, and etc.  I can't find the link. <_<
Its just a metapackage.  Perhaps you're thinking of the 3rd party (evil) tools such as automatix.
That lists the currently logged in users and the groups that your user is in
X Window Server (ie Xming X Server) is needed to run Linux apps over Windows? o.O
If you intend to forward X over ssh, yes.

If you're looking for a specific package, you can either use packages.ubuntu.com, or aptitude changelog $packagename, or if you want to see changelogs for current updates, then install apt-listchanges.
